pull.title: build: sync ax_boost_base from upstream
pull.body:
I upstreamed our change, https://github.com/autoconf-archive/autoconf-archive/pull/260, so sync with upstream.

Slightly simplifies #25465.

verification.payload:
tree 08242ebcd542982413ecef263545a2ddbba4618e
parent 604015ac7955695209dd6405db2c595e60e135b3
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1662282616 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1662282616 +0100

build: sync ax_boost_base from upstream

I upstreamed our change,
https://github.com/autoconf-archive/autoconf-archive/pull/260, so sync
with upstream.

Slightly simplifies #25465.

events.message:
build: sync ax_boost_base from upstream

I upstreamed our change,
https://github.com/autoconf-archive/autoconf-archive/pull/260, so sync
with upstream.

Slightly simplifies #25465.

issue.title: build: remove boost library detection
issue.body:
We no longer link against any Boost libraries, so don't need to detect them, or set any Boost related LDFLAGS. Removing this from the macro also allows cleaning up some code in our configure.

Guix Build:
```bash
e1ca070d085115767415121f3be8d8fa29547c9df633f9782b168a00753e995a  guix-build-db648e8ccc69/output/aarch64-linux-gnu/SHA256SUMS.part
```

events.body:
tACK 85f0f93

File matches the new upstream and I can still compile on an Intel mac (though this change is for arm64).
